{{also|Reisen}} ==German== ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|[ˈʁaɪ̯zn̩]|[ˈʁaɪ̯zən]}} * {{audio|de|De-reisen.ogg|audio}} ===Etymology 1=== From {{etyl|gmh|de}} {{m|gmh|reisen}}, from {{etyl|goh|de}} {{m|goh|reisōn||to arise, set out, set out on a journey}} (compare {{cog|goh|reisa||a setting out, expedtion, journey}}), from {{etyl|gem-pro|de}} {{m|gem-pro|*raisōną||to set out, depart}}, from {{etyl|ine-pro|de}} {{m|ine-pro|*rey-||to rise, arise}}. Cognate with {{cog|frr|reyse||travel, expedition}}, {{cog|da|rejse||journey, trip, travel}}, {{cog|sv|resa||trip, journey}}, (obsolete) {{cog|en|reyse||to journey, travel, go on a military expedition}}. ====Verb==== {{de-verb-weak|reist|reiste|gereist|auxiliary=sein}} # {{lb|de|intransitive}} to [[travel]] =====Conjugation===== {{de-conj-weak|reis|gereist|s||a}} =====Derived terms===== {{der-top}} * {{l|de|abreisen}} * {{l|de|anreisen}} * {{l|de|ausreisen}} * {{l|de|bereisen}} * {{l|de|durchreisen}} {{der-mid}} * {{l|de|einreisen}} * {{l|de|nachreisen}} * {{l|de|verreisen}} * {{l|de|vorausreisen}} * {{l|de|weiterreisen}} {{der-bottom}} ===Etymology 2=== From {{etyl|gmh|de}} {{m|gmh|rīsen||to fall, fall out}}, from {{etyl|goh|de}} {{m|goh|rīsan||to fall, fall down}}, from {{etyl|gem-pro|de}} {{m|gem-pro|*rīsaną||to rise, move vertically up or down, go}}, from {{etyl|ine-pro|de}} {{m|ine-pro|*rei-||to rise, arise}}. Cognate with {{cog|nds|risen}}, {{cog|nl|rijzen}}, {{cog|ang|rīsan||to rise}} (modern English {{m|en|rise}}), Icelandic {{m|is|rísa}}. More at {{l|en|rise}}. ====Verb==== {{de-verb}} # {{lb|de|intransitive|dialectal}} to [[fall]] ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} ---- ==Middle Dutch== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|dum|odt|*reison}}, from {{inh|dum|gem-pro|*raisōną}}.
